symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to high
symptoms.pattern: Present in acute pulmonary histoplasmosis; may be absent in other forms

symptoms.name: Cough
symptoms.pattern: Present in acute and chronic pulmonary histoplasmosis

symptoms.name: Shortness of breath
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Present in acute and disseminated histoplasmosis

symptoms.name: Night sweats
symptoms.pattern: Present in chronic cavitary pulmonary histoplasmosis

symptoms.name: Weight loss
symptoms.pattern: Present in chronic cavitary and disseminated histoplasmosis

physical_findings: Crackles or rales on lung auscultation (in pulmonary involvement)

lab_values.Histoplasma antibodies: May be present, but less sensitive than antigen detection
lab_values.Liver function tests: May be abnormal in severe cases

risk_factors: Exposure to bird or bat droppings
Weakened immune system (HIV, cancer, organ transplant)
Occupation or hobbies involving disturbance of soil

imaging_findings.Chest X-ray: May show pulmonary nodules, infiltrates, or cavities
imaging_findings.CT scan: Provides more detailed images of lung lesions

required: Positive Histoplasma antigen test (urine or serum)
Positive Histoplasma culture from clinical specimens
Histopathological evidence of Histoplasma infection in tissue biopsy
